Scholarship_Name: Government of Ireland International Education Scholarship
Funding_Details:
*   Stipend: A €10,000 stipend awarded for one academic year of full-time study.
*   Tuition Fee Waiver: A full waiver of tuition fees and other registration costs from the host Irish Higher Education Institution.
Eligibility: Open to citizens of countries outside the European Union (EU), European Economic Area (EEA), United Kingdom, and Switzerland. Applicants must hold a conditional or final offer of admission to a full-time Master's, postgraduate diploma, or PhD programme (NFQ levels 9 or 10) at an eligible Irish HEI. Previous GOI-IES scholarship holders are not eligible.
Eligible_Applicants:
*   Nationality: The scholarship is open to citizens of countries outside the European Union (EU), European Economic Area (EEA), United Kingdom, and Switzerland. For example, Vietnamese citizens are eligible to apply.
*   Age Requirements: There is no age limit prescribed for applicants.
*   Academic Level: Candidates must have applied for, and hold a conditional or final offer of admission to, a full-time Master's, postgraduate diploma, or PhD programme (NFQ levels 9 or 10) at an eligible Irish HEI.
*   Previous Scholarship Holders: Applicants who have previously received a GOI-IES scholarship are not eligible to apply again.
*   Work Requirements: While work experience is considered during the selection process, there is no explicit minimum work experience requirement for eligibility.
Eligible_Fields: Wide range of disciplines across various Irish higher education institutions.
Scholarship_Info: The Government of Ireland International Education Scholarship (GOI-IES) is a prestigious, fully funded program designed to attract high-calibre international students to pursue Master's, postgraduate diploma, or PhD studies in Ireland. Funded by the Government of Ireland and managed by the Higher Education Authority (HEA), this initiative awards 60 scholarships annually.
Application_Documents:
*   Offer of Admission: A copy of a conditional or final offer of admission from an eligible Irish HEI is mandatory.
*   Personal Statement: A carefully prepared personal statement is required, demonstrating academic excellence and alignment with the scholarship goals and candidate profile.
*   Reference Letters: Applicants must submit reference letters, typically between 500 and 1,000 words. Referees should provide specific information demonstrating how the applicant matches the candidate profile outlined in the call document. It is the candidate's responsibility to upload the references provided by their referees to the application portal.

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Fixed Amount, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
Recipients receive a grant of 9000 Euros.
Covered Expenses:
*   Tuition fee coverage.
*   Health insurance.
Scholarship Duration: Scholarships may be awarded for periods of 3, 6, or 9 months, depending on the program. Grants specifically for Italian Language and Culture Courses are awarded for a period of 3 months only.
Renewal: The MAECI scholarship can be renewed for the following academic year, provided students meet performance requirements.
Eligibility: Open to foreign students not residing in Italy and Italian citizens living abroad (IRE). Applicants for Master’s Degree programs, Higher Education in Arts, Music, and Dance (AFAM) Programs, or Italian Language and Culture Courses must be under 28 years old by the application deadline. Exceptions may apply for renewals. Applicants for PhD programs and research under academic supervision must also meet specific age requirements defined in the official call. Applicants must not be residing in Italy at the time of application, unless they are Italian citizens living abroad (IRE). Applicants must not be receiving any other Italian government scholarship concurrently.
Eligible_Applicants:
*   Foreign students not residing in Italy
*   Italian citizens living abroad (IRE)
Eligible_Fields:
Master’s Degrees
Higher Education in Arts, Music, and Dance (AFAM) Programs
PhD Programs
Research under Academic Supervision
Italian Language and Culture Courses
University Degrees (including undergraduate programs)
Specialization and Vocational Schools
Training Programs
Required_Degree: Bachelor's degree, Relevant Master's degree, Bachelor's equivalent
Language_Certificate: Italian B2 CEFR, English (IELTS, TOEFL), Italian A2 CEFR
Age: Under 28 for Master’s, AFAM, Italian Language and Culture Courses; specific requirements for PhD and research.
Career_Plan: A detailed motivation letter outlining career goals, future plans, and specific reasons for choosing the university and city is essential.
Other_Requirements: Two presentation letters (reference letters) must be recorded in the online application system. A comprehensive Curriculum Vitae (CV) detailing educational background, work experience, skills (e.g., Excel, Python, IT tools), projects, and internships (if any) is required. Letter of acceptance from the relevant Italian University (mandatory for PhD applicants).
Scholarship_Info: The Italian Government Scholarship, provided by the MAECI, is a prestigious initiative designed to support international students and Italian citizens living abroad (IRE) in pursuing higher education in Italy. Its primary goals are to strengthen international cultural and scientific cooperation, promote the Italian language, and enhance the visibility of the Italian higher education system worldwide.
Application_Documents:
*   Language test scores (Italian or English).
*   Statement of Purpose or Letter of Motivation.
*   Two Letters of Recommendation.
*   Curriculum Vitae (CV).
*   Academic transcripts and degree certificates.
*   SAT/ACT/GRE/GMAT and other relevant test scores (if applicable).
*   Letter of acceptance from the relevant Italian University (mandatory for PhD applicants).
Timeline:
May 2024 : Applications for the 2025-2026 academic year opened.
16/05/2025 : Application Deadline (2:00 PM CET).

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Accommodation, Partial Funding, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
Funding Details:
*   Fully Funded: Covers a comprehensive range of expenses.
*   Partially Funded: Provides financial assistance, with some sources indicating up to CNY 2000 per month.

Covered Expenses:
The scholarship typically covers essential expenses, including:
*   Tuition fees (specifically, tuition for the first year of bachelor's degree study and tuition for three years of master's degree study are mentioned).
*   Study materials.
*   Accommodation.
*   Other study-related expenses.
Quantity: Approximately 50 fully-funded scholarships are awarded each year.
Eligibility:
Applicants for the Tianjin Government Scholarship must meet a set of general and program-specific requirements:

3.1. Nationality and Health:
*   Applicants must be non-Chinese citizens holding a valid passport.
*   Applicants must be in good health.

3.2. Academic Level and Age Requirements:
Age requirements vary significantly by the level of study and the specific university:
*   General:
    *   For Master's programs: Typically under 35 years old.
    *   For PhD programs: Typically under 40 years old.
*   Specific University Examples:
    *   Tianjin University of Technology and Education: Applicants should be under the age of 30.
    *   Tianjin University: Master's applicants must hold a Bachelor's degree and be under 35 years old; PhD applicants must hold a Master's degree and be under 40 years old.
    *   Other Sources: Some information indicates applicants for doctoral programs should be under 40, and those for other programs (e.g., undergraduate) under 45, having completed at least two years of undergraduate study.
*   Tianjin Normal University: Age limits are based on the program level.

3.3. Academic Background:
*   Applicants must hold the required degree for their chosen program (e.g., Bachelor's for Master's programs, Master's for PhD programs).
*   Minimum GPA: For Tianjin University, a GPA over 2.8/4, 3.5/5, or 70/100 is generally considered eligible.

3.4. Work Experience:
*   Work experience is not universally required but is preferred for some programs or universities. Specifically, some programs prefer applicants who hold a Bachelor's diploma with at least three years of working experience or a related educational/working background.

3.5. Current Student Status:
*   The scholarship is open to both prospective students and current self-funded international students already enrolled in undergraduate, postgraduate, or PhD programs in Tianjin.
Eligible_Applicants:
*   Non-Chinese citizens holding a valid passport.
*   In good health.
*   International students from countries other than the People's Republic of China, including Vietnamese citizens.
*   Prospective students and current self-funded international students already enrolled in undergraduate, postgraduate, or PhD programs in Tianjin.
*   Applicants must hold the required degree for their chosen program (e.g., Bachelor's for Master's programs, Master's for PhD programs).
Language_Certificate: HSK 5 180, HSK 4, HSK 5, IELTS 6.0, TOEFL 80, English Proficiency Certificate
Age: Under 35 (Master's), Under 40 (PhD), Under 30 (Tianjin University of Technology and Education), Under 45 (some undergraduate programs)
Other_Requirements: Applicants must be non-Chinese citizens holding a valid passport and be in good health. Open to prospective students and current self-funded international students. Work experience (at least 3 years with Bachelor's diploma) preferred for some programs. Native Chinese speakers or those with previous degree in Chinese may be exempt from HSK. English proficiency proofs required for English-taught programs. Applicants must research specific university requirements and deadlines. Direct consultation with the target university's international student office is highly recommended.
Scholarship_Info: The Tianjin Government Scholarship is a prestigious program established by the Tianjin Municipal Government to attract outstanding international students to pursue higher education in China. It aims to immerse students in the vibrant academic and cultural atmosphere of Tianjin, one of China's largest and most rapidly developing cities. The scholarship is open to international students from countries other than the People's Republic of China, including Vietnamese citizens, who wish to undertake undergraduate, master's, or doctoral studies at eligible Higher Education Institutions in Tianjin.
Application_Documents:
Applicants must prepare a comprehensive set of documents, which may vary slightly by university and program. The common requirements include:
*   Tianjin Government Scholarship Application Form: Duly completed and signed.
*   Personal Statement: A study or research plan, including personal background, financial situation, and personal strengths. It should be written in Chinese or English, with a minimum of 800 words for Master's and Doctoral degrees, and no less than 300 words for Bachelor's degree applications.
*   Admission Letter: An official letter of admission from a Tianjin university.
*   Visa Application Form: Form JW202 or JW201.
*   Physical Examination Report and Test Report: Original copy required.
*   Passport: A valid passport with a validity period of at least six months.
*   No Crime Certificate: An original certificate confirming no criminal record.
*   Language Proficiency Certificates:
    *   For Chinese-taught programs: HSK certificate (e.g., HSK-5 with 180+ for Tianjin University, HSK 4/5 for Tianjin Normal University).
    *   For English-taught programs: English proficiency certificate (e.g., IELTS 6.0 or TOEFL 80 for Tianjin Foreign Studies University).
*   Academic Transcripts and Diplomas: (Implied by general scholarship application requirements, though not explicitly listed in the provided document list, it's a standard requirement for higher education).
Timeline:
October 15, 2024 : Application Opening (e.g., for Tianjin University)
May 20, 2025 : Application Deadline (Nankai University)
May 31, 2025 : Application Deadline (Tianjin University)
June 30, 2025 : Application Deadline (Tianjin Normal University)
July 1 - August 31 : Admission results and documents sent to scholarship winners (Tianjin University)

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Fixed Amount
Funding_Details:
Grant: A grant of €10,020 per academic year is provided to cover living expenses.
Tuition Fee Waiver: In addition to the grant, the scholarship includes a full tuition fee waiver for the duration of the Master's program.
Duration: The scholarship duration is one academic year for Master's programs comprising 60 ECTS credits, or two academic years for programs with 120 ECTS credits.
Restrictions: It is important to note that the Master Mind Scholarship cannot be combined with any other scholarship provided by the Flemish Government.
Eligibility: The scholarship is open to outstanding international students from around the world.
Eligible_Applicants:
Nationality: Open to international students worldwide. Five scholarships are specifically reserved for American students.
Age Requirements: Applicants for Master's programs must be 30 years old or younger by the time of application. For PhD students (though the scholarship primarily targets Master's), the age limit is 35 years.
Work Requirements: Professional experience and employment are not mandatory for a Master's program application. However, having relevant professional experience can be considered a competitive advantage during the selection process.
Previous Study in Flanders: Students who have previously obtained a degree from a Flemish higher education institution are generally not eligible. However, an exception is made for international students who were previously enrolled in a Flemish institution on credit mobility programs (e.g., Erasmus+). Students already enrolled in a Flemish higher education institution cannot apply.
Eligible_Fields: Any eligible Master's degree program offered at a participating Flemish higher education institution in Flanders and Brussels. Preparatory programs are explicitly ineligible.
Age: Under 30 for Master's, Under 35 for PhD
Other_Requirements: Two signed letters of recommendation from professors or a recent employer; Motivation letter written in English.
Scholarship_Info: The Master Mind Scholarship is a prestigious program provided by the Government of Flanders to attract outstanding international students to pursue Master's degrees in Flanders and Brussels, Belgium. Launched in 2015, it aims to facilitate access to esteemed higher education institutions in the region, including but not limited to KU Leuven, University of Antwerp, and Ghent University.
Application_Documents:
Master Mind Scholarship Application Form
English language test results (or a letter of exemption provided by the host university)
Letter of motivation (written in English)
Two signed letters of recommendation
Acceptance letter from the host institution for an eligible Master's program
KU Leuven Scholarships & Master Mind Candidacy Form (if applying via KU Leuven)
Timeline:
January 15, 2025 : University Admission/Nomination Deadline (e.g., KU Leuven)
March 15, 2025 : Master Mind Application Form Deadline for preselected candidates
April 27, 2025 : Overall Scholarship Application Deadline

Funding_Details:
Key Benefits Include:
*   Full Tuition Coverage: The scholarship covers 100% of tuition fees for the chosen postgraduate program.
*   Monthly Stipends: Recipients receive a monthly stipend equivalent to three minimum wages, providing living expenses.
*   Health Insurance: Comprehensive health insurance is provided for the duration of the scholarship.
*   No Application Fee: The application process for this scholarship is entirely free of charge.
Eligibility: Open to foreign citizens of all nationalities (excluding Colombian citizens or dual nationals), not residing in Colombia for the last six months, aged 25-50, with a minimum of one year of professional experience. Previous beneficiaries or applicants with family/marital ties in Colombia are not eligible.
Eligible_Applicants:
*   Nationality: The scholarship is open to foreign citizens of all nationalities. Applicants must not be Colombian citizens and must not hold dual Colombian nationality.
*   Residency: Candidates must not be residing in Colombia at the time of application, nor have resided in Colombia for the last six months prior to applying for the scholarship. They must also not have commenced postgraduate studies in Colombia at the time of application.
*   Age: Applicants must be between 25 and 50 years old.
*   Professional Experience: A minimum of one year of certified professional experience is required.
*   Previous Beneficiaries: Individuals who have previously been beneficiaries of this program are not eligible to reapply.
*   Family Ties: Applicants must not have family or marital ties in Colombia.
Eligible_Fields: Postgraduate studies (Master's, Doctoral, or Specialization Degree programs) offered by public and private Colombian higher education institutions and included in the official Academic Offer Catalog.
Language_Certificate: DELE B2, SIELE B2, A1 (for specific language-focused programs)
Career_Plan: Required as part of the personal statement/essay to articulate academic/career aspirations.
Scholarship_Info: The Colombia Government Scholarship, officially known as the "Beca Colombia" scholarship program, is a prestigious initiative provided by the Colombian Government through ICETEX. This program aims to attract international students to pursue postgraduate studies in Colombia, fostering academic and professional development within the country.
Application_Documents:
*   Online application form
*   Academic curriculum (CV/Resume)
*   Academic recommendation letter(s)
*   Passport copy
*   Health Certificate
*   Final admission letter (from 1 to 3 programs from eligible Colombian institutions)
*   University degree certificate
*   Verified copies of educational transcripts (undergraduate/graduate)
*   Certificate of professional experience
*   Personal statement (essay)

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Accommodation, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
The TIPP scholarship is fully funded, covering the majority of expenses for successful candidates pursuing Master's degrees.
*   Funding Details: The scholarship is fully covered by TICA.
*   Covered Expenses:
    *   Return economy class air ticket and airport pick-up service.
    *   Monthly subsistence allowance.
    *   Living allowance.
    *   Tuition Fees.
*   Exclusions (Costs NOT Covered):
    *   Equipment insurance, transcripts, and certificate fees.
    *   Costs arising from visa applications (e.g., visa fee, travel to the Royal Thai Embassy/Consulate, postal fees).
    *   Costs related to pre-existing illnesses, dental treatment, brain disease, mental illness, pregnancy, and glasses. Awardees are advised to arrange their own insurance for such eventualities.
Quantity: Not specified, but relevant governmental agencies of OIC Member States are requested to nominate up to five (5) candidates per course.
Eligibility: Open to international students from eligible countries/territories, generally under 45 years old, with a minimum of 3 years working experience, good health, and a strong academic record. Nomination may be required for OIC Member States.
Eligible_Applicants:
- International students from eligible countries/territories (List published by TICA)
- No more than 45 years of age
- Minimum of three (3) years of working experience
- In good physical and mental condition
- For OIC Member States, nominated by relevant governmental agencies
- Strong academic record, often evidenced by a high GPA in undergraduate studies
Eligible_Fields:
Sufficiency Economy Philosophy (SEP)
Public Health
Agriculture and Food Security
Climate Change and Environmental Issues
Bio-Circular-Green Economy (BCG Model)
Other topics related to the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs)
Language_Certificate: English Language proficiency test, Thai Language proficiency test
Age: No more than 45 years of age
Other_Requirements:
Awardees are required to study full-time.
Changing the programme topic or study plan is not permitted.
Any part-time employment during the scholarship period is strictly not allowed.
Recommendation letters from at least two persons.
A comprehensive statement of purpose is required.
Scholarship_Info: The Thailand International Postgraduate Programme (TIPP) is a fully funded Master's scholarship initiative by the Thailand International Cooperation Agency (TICA). Established in 2000, TIPP aims to share Thailand's development expertise and best practices with other developing countries, focusing on themes aligned with the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs).
Application_Documents:
The application package typically includes:
*   Completed TIPP Application Form.
*   Hard copy of the application form and other related documents.
*   Guidelines for TIPP (specific to the application year).
*   List of Eligible Countries/Territories.
*   Certificate of Bachelor's degree.
*   Official academic transcripts.
*   Recommendation Letters (from at least two persons).
*   Statement of Purpose.
*   English Language proficiency certificate/scores (if applicable).
*   Thai language proficiency tests results (if applicable, for Thai-taught programs).
*   Medical certificate.
Timeline:
January 31, 2025 : Application Deadline (to Royal Thai Embassy/Permanent Mission of Thailand to the United Nations/Royal Thai Consulate-General)
January 22, 2025 : Example local embassy deadline (some specific announcements)

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
The KNB Scholarship is a fully funded program, providing comprehensive financial support to its recipients. The covered expenses include:
*   Living Allowance: Rp. 1,850,000 per month during the Indonesian language course (BIPA) and preparatory programs.
*   Research and Book Allowance: A monthly allowance provided upon arrival in Indonesia for the duration of the scholarship.
*   Health Insurance: Coverage with a maximum monthly premium of IDR 400,000.
*   Settlement Allowance: A one-time payment of IDR 1,500,000 provided upon the student's arrival in Indonesia.
*   Tuition Fees: Fully covered for the chosen degree program.
*   Airfare: Typically includes a round-trip international airfare.
Quantity: Approximately 200 scholarships are offered annually across all levels of study and fields. The program involves 34 participating Indonesian universities, offering a wide array of study programs.
Eligibility: Applicants must be citizens of developing countries.
Eligible_Applicants:
Nationality: Applicants must be citizens of developing countries.
Age Requirements:
*   For Bachelor's degree applicants: Maximum 21 years old.
*   For Master's degree applicants: Maximum 35 years old.
*   For Doctoral degree applicants: Maximum 40 years old.
Work Requirements: While not a universal requirement, applicants who are currently employed must provide a recommendation letter from their employer/immediate supervisor. Specific programs or countries may have additional work experience requirements (e.g., two years of work experience for government employees in Tanzania).
Eligible_Fields: Eligible Fields: Public Administration, Political Science, Sociology, Psychology, Law, Economics/Development Studies, Humanities, Engineering, Educational Science Education
Required_Degree: Bachelor's equivalent, Bachelor's degree, Relevant Master's degree
Career_Plan: Applicants are required to articulate their career goals and explain how the KNB Scholarship and their chosen education will help them achieve these goals.
Other_Requirements:
Reference Letters:
*   Recommendation letter from the Indonesian Embassy or the Indonesian Consulate General in the applicant's home country. This is a crucial first step, as applicants cannot register without it.
*   Recommendation letter from the employer/immediate supervisor (if working), in English or Bahasa Indonesia.
*   Academic Recommendation Letter from previous schools/universities.
*   For Doctoral applicants only: A recommendation letter from a potential research supervisor at one of the KNB Scholarship partner universities, in English or Bahasa Indonesia.

Master's degree holders are generally not eligible to apply for another Master's degree program under this scholarship.
Specific programs or countries may have additional work experience requirements (e.g., two years of work experience for government employees in Tanzania).
Scholarship_Info: The Kemitraan Negara Berkembang (KNB) Scholarship is a prestigious, fully funded scholarship program offered by the Government of the Republic of Indonesia. It aims to support international students from developing countries in pursuing Bachelor's, Master's, and Doctoral degrees at various Indonesian universities. The scholarship covers a wide range of academic fields and provides comprehensive financial support, including living allowances, health insurance, and research funds.
Application_Documents:
Applicants must prepare and submit the following documents:
*   Passport (scanned copy)
*   Formal Photo
*   Curriculum Vitae (detailing education background, achievements, and work experience)
*   Health Certificate (signed by a licensed doctor)
*   Academic Certificate and Academic Transcript from previous degrees
*   Embassy Recommendation Letter (as mentioned above)
*   Other recommendation letters as specified in the "Additional Requirements" section.

Funding_Details:
The RTP Scholarships offer comprehensive financial support, which can include a full tuition fee offset, an annual living stipend, and various allowances.
Recipients of the RTP may receive:
*   Full Tuition Fee Offset: Covers 100% of tuition fees for the duration of the scholarship. For international students, this often includes Overseas Student Health Cover (OSHC).
*   Annual Living Stipend: This stipend assists with general living costs. The rates vary by university and are indexed annually. For 2025, the Australian Government’s RTP base stipend rate is $33,511 AUD per annum (e.g., at Curtin University). Some universities may offer higher rates, such as $41,753 p.a. at the University of Sydney for 2025. For historical context, the 2019 RTP stipend was $27,596 p.a.
*   Allowances: These can include relocation allowances, thesis costs, and other ancillary costs associated with an HDR degree, such as conference attendance, software training, and translation services.

Scholarship Duration:
*   Research Doctorates: Scholarships are available for a minimum of 3 years and up to a maximum of 4 years for full-time students. For part-time research doctorates, the duration can range from 6 to 8 years, at the discretion of the Higher Education Provider (HEP). Some universities specify a duration of three years and six months full-time for a doctoral degree.
*   Research Masters: The duration is typically 2 years for full-time students.

Other Scholarship Holdings: Students cannot normally receive another scholarship that provides a living allowance greater than 75% of the RTP stipend.

Covered Expenses:
*   Full tuition fee offset
*   Annual living stipend
*   Relocation allowances
*   Thesis costs
*   Overseas Student Health Cover (OSHC) for international students
*   Ancillary costs such as conference attendance, software training, and translation services (Allowance Scholarships).
Quantity: University of Sydney: approximately 30 students each year. Avondale University: limited number. Over 40 Australian universities are expected to provide RTP scholarships in 2026.
Eligibility: RTP Scholarships are open to both domestic and international students undertaking a Higher Degree by Research (HDR) at an Australian university. Applicants must be enrolled in an accredited course of study at an Australian Higher Education Provider. Both commencing and currently enrolled students in a higher degree by research are eligible. The scholarship is available to domestic (Australian and New Zealand citizens, Australian permanent residents, and permanent humanitarian visa holders) and international students. Full-time candidates may undertake limited work experience or employment during their candidature, provided it does not interfere with their research progress. Higher Education Providers (HEPs) have the discretion to apply selection criteria and prioritise specific cohorts of students, including those undertaking an HDR for the first time.
Eligible_Applicants:
*   Domestic (Australian and New Zealand citizens, Australian permanent residents, and permanent humanitarian visa holders)
*   International students
*   Commencing and currently enrolled students in a higher degree by research
*   Applicants must be enrolled in an accredited course of study at an Australian Higher Education Provider
Other_Requirements: Applicants must identify and contact a potential Principal Supervisor and Co-Supervisor in their research area who agree to supervise them and sign their application.
Scholarship_Info: The Australia Research Training Program (RTP) Scholarships are a prestigious government initiative provided by the Australian Government. These scholarships are designed to support both domestic and international students undertaking a Higher Degree by Research (HDR) in Australia. The program aims to foster high-achieving research students across various Australian universities.
Application_Documents:
The application process typically involves several key documents:
*   Research Proposal: A 1-2 page research proposal outlining the intended research project.
*   Application Form: A completed application form, often requiring signatures from the proposed supervisory team (Principal Supervisor and Co-Supervisor).
*   Supporting Documents: All required supporting documents, which may include academic transcripts, proof of English proficiency, and curriculum vitae.
*   Expression of Interest (EOI) Form: Some universities, like Curtin, require an Expression of Interest (EOI) form as a first step before a full admission application.
Timeline:
April (ACU) : Application Opening
1 July (Curtin) : Application Opening
October (ACU) : Application Opening
1 October 2025 (ACU) : Application Deadline
31 October (Curtin) : Admission Application Deadline
31 October 2025 (SCU) : Application Deadline
Each year (University of Sydney) : Approximately 30 awards
2026 : Over 40 Australian universities expected to provide scholarships

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Accommodation, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
A monthly stipend of 800 AZN (approximately 470 USD) is provided for 10 months per year. This allowance is intended to cover living expenses, including lodging and instructional materials.
Covered Expenses: The scholarship package includes:
*   Tuition fees
*   International flights
*   Monthly allowance
*   Medical insurance
*   Visa & registration costs
Eligibility: Open to international students from over 150 countries, including nationals of OIC (Organisation of Islamic Cooperation), NAM (Non-Aligned Movement), SIDS (Small Island Developing States) member countries, or countries with cultural ties to Azerbaijan. Applicants must be nominated by the relevant national authorities of their home country. Candidates should demonstrate strong academic performance (minimum GPA of 70%) and show motivation and leadership potential.
Eligible_Applicants:
*   Citizenship: Open to international students from over 150 countries, including nationals of OIC (Organisation of Islamic Cooperation), NAM (Non-Aligned Movement), SIDS (Small Island Developing States) member countries, or countries with cultural ties to Azerbaijan. Specific examples of eligible countries include Antigua and Barbuda, Egypt, Barbados, and Liberia.
*   Nomination: Applicants must be nominated by the relevant national authorities of their home country.
*   Academic Strength: Candidates should demonstrate strong academic performance (minimum GPA of 70%) and show motivation and leadership potential.
Eligible_Fields:
Preparatory Courses
Undergraduate Programs
Graduate (Master’s) Programs
Doctoral Programs
General Medicine Programs
Residency Programs
Age:
Undergraduate and General Medicine Programs: below 35 years
Graduate (Master’s) and Medical Residency Programs: below 40 years
Doctoral Programs: below 45 years
Other_Requirements:
*   Foreign Qualifications: All applicants with foreign qualifications are required to have their documents equated.
*   Recommendation Letters: Two Recommendation Letters are required from academic or professional referees.
*   Personal Statement: A personal statement is a mandatory component of the application.
*   Research Proposal: Applicants for Ph.D. programs must submit a research proposal.
*   Language Proficiency: Proficiency in the language of study (English, Azerbaijani, Russian, or Turkish) is mandatory. For Russian or Turkish Programs: Proof of language proficiency is required. For Azerbaijani Programs: Proof of English, Russian, or Turkish proficiency is required.
Scholarship_Info: The Heydar Aliyev International Education Grant Program, provided by the Government of the Republic of Azerbaijan, offers fully funded scholarships for international students to pursue higher education in Azerbaijan. Renamed in honor of the former Azerbaijani president, this prestigious program aims to foster academic exchange and strengthen international cooperation by supporting foreign nationals in preparatory courses, undergraduate, graduate (master’s), doctoral, general medicine, or residency programs.
Application_Documents:
*   Completed application form
*   Copy of a valid passport
*   CV or Resume
*   Two Letters of Recommendation (from academic or professional referees)
*   Personal Statement
*   Research Proposal (for Ph.D. applicants)
*   Documents for foreign qualifications to be equated
*   Proof of language proficiency
*   Valid USAT/HAT test score

Scholarship_Name: National Scholarship Programme of the Slovak Republic
Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Stipend, Accommodation, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
The National Scholarship Programme offers fully funded academic and research opportunities. The scholarship is specifically intended to cover international scholarship holders' living costs and travel expenses associated with their stay in Slovakia. Travel grants are provided as a flat rate.
*   Living costs
*   Accommodation
*   Board
*   Travel costs

Monthly Scholarship Amounts (for researchers/teachers/artists):
*   Without PhD degree and with less than 4 years of experience: €1,025.50/month
*   With PhD degree and with less than 10 years of experience: €1,370/month
*   With PhD degree and with more than 10 years of experience: €1,470/month
Quantity: The number of scholarships awarded is contingent upon the available funds and the overall quality of the applications received.
Eligibility: The program is open to applicants from all world countries, with specific academic, experience, and language proficiency requirements.
Eligible_Applicants:
*   University students (Bachelor's, Master's, PhD candidates), university teachers, researchers, and artists are eligible.
*   Master's students must be currently enrolled at a non-Slovak university and must have completed at least 2.5 years of higher education before the commencement of their scholarship stay.
*   Students of the second level of higher education are explicitly eligible.
Eligible_Fields: Academic, research, creative, study, and teaching stays across various disciplines.
Language_Certificate: IELTS C1, TOEFL C1, Duolingo English Test
Age: No upper age limit for Bachelor's study. Applicants under the age of 18 will require assistance with their application and stay.
Special_Circumstances: In special cases, candidates without a PhD but with more than 4 years but not more than 7 years of work experience may be accepted. However, such applicants will be awarded the scholarship amount corresponding to those without a PhD degree and with less than 4 years of experience.
Career_Plan: Master's students must submit a detailed study program as part of their application.
Other_Requirements: For Master's students, two recommendation letters issued by their university teachers are required.
Scholarship_Info: The National Scholarship Programme of the Slovak Republic (NSP) is a prestigious, fully funded initiative designed to support the mobility of international students, PhD candidates, university teachers, researchers, and artists for academic, research, or creative stays in Slovakia. Established in 2005 and administered by the Slovak Academic Information Agency (SAIA, n.o.), with funding from the Ministry of Education, Research, Development, and Youth of the Slovak Republic, the NSP aims to foster academic excellence and cultural exchange.
Application_Documents:
Applicants must submit an online application form along with the following attachments:
*   Motivation letter
*   Curriculum vitae
*   Proof of English language proficiency
*   Current Education Documents (authenticated)
*   Admission/invitation letter from a Slovak university or research institution (must be issued in Slovak or English)
*   Detailed study programme (for Master's students)
*   Two recommendation letters (for Master's students)

All applications and required attachments must be submitted in Slovak or English. Documents originally written in other languages must include official translations into Slovak or English. In extraordinary circumstances caused by force majeure, unofficial translations by the applicant may be temporarily accepted, but official translations will be required before the scholarship award is finalized.
Timeline:
March 24, 2025 : Webpage (www.vladnestipendia.sk) active and online application system typically opens
April 30, 2025 : Application Deadline for the 2025/2026 academic year

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Accommodation, Partial Funding, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
The scholarship offers varying levels of financial support, ranging from partial to fully funded awards.
The scholarship can be fully funded, covering both tuition and accommodation, or it can be a partial scholarship primarily covering tuition fees.
For doctoral students, a specific tuition-only scholarship amount of 40,000 RMB per person per year has been noted.
While a living allowance is generally not paid, comprehensive insurance is normally purchased for scholarship recipients.
The scholarship typically covers:
*   Tuition fees (fully or partially)
*   Accommodation (in some fully funded instances)
*   Comprehensive insurance
Eligibility: Applicants must be non-Chinese citizens and in good health.
Eligible_Applicants:

*   Applicants must be in good health.
*   Undergraduate students: Must be under 25 years of age at the time of enrollment.
*   Master's degree students: Must be under 35 years of age.

Eligible_Fields:
Bachelor's Degrees
Master's Degrees
Doctoral Degrees
Chinese language training
Relevant advanced studies
Specialized training
Age: Undergraduate students: Under 25, Master's degree students: Under 35, Doctoral degree students: Generally similar to Master's students

Other_Requirements:

Applicants must be in good health.

Scholarship_Info: The Beijing Government Scholarship (BGS), officially known as 北京市外国留学生奖学金, is a prestigious scholarship program established by the Beijing Municipal Government. Its primary objective is to encourage and support outstanding international students to pursue higher education, conduct research, or engage in specialized training within the capital city of China. The scholarship is provided by the Beijing Municipal Government and facilitates study exclusively in China, specifically within universities and colleges located in the Beijing region.
Application_Documents:
*   Application Form for Beijing Municipal Government Scholarship
*   Pre-admission letter (required for postgraduate and senior scholar applicants)
*   Online application (through the specific university's online application system, selecting the "Beijing Government Scholarship" option)
*   Academic transcripts
*   Degree certificates
*   Language proficiency certificates
*   Passport copy
*   Physical examination form

Scholarship_Name: Swedish Institute Scholarships for Global Professionals (SISGP)
Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
The SISGP is a fully funded master's scholarship, providing comprehensive financial support to its recipients. The benefits include:
*   Full Tuition Fees: All tuition fees are paid directly to the respective Swedish university.
*   Monthly Living Allowance: A monthly stipend ranging from SEK 11,000 to SEK 12,000 is provided to cover living expenses.
*   Travel Grant: A travel grant is included, typically ranging from SEK 10,000 to SEK 15,000, to assist with international travel costs.
*   Insurance: Comprehensive insurance coverage is provided for the duration of the scholarship.
Eligibility: Applicants must be citizens of one of the approximately 33 eligible countries across Africa, Asia, Latin America, and Eastern Europe (e.g., Vietnam). No age limits. Minimum of 3,000 hours of demonstrated employment or work experience is required before the scholarship application deadline, including full-time, part-time, or leadership experience.
Eligible_Applicants:
*   Citizenship: Applicants must be citizens of one of the countries eligible for the scholarship program (e.g., Vietnam), from approximately 33 eligible countries across Africa, Asia, Latin America, and Eastern Europe.
*   Age Requirements: No age limits or restrictions.
*   Work Experience: A minimum of 3,000 hours of demonstrated employment or work experience is required, gained before the scholarship application deadline, including full-time, part-time, or leadership experience.
Eligible_Fields: A large number of master's programs at Swedish universities (specific list published by Swedish Institute)
Other_Requirements: Candidates must have applied for, or already be admitted to, an eligible master's program at a Swedish university before applying for the scholarship. Applicants should submit only one scholarship application in the SI application portal.
Scholarship_Info: The Swedish Institute Scholarships for Global Professionals (SISGP) is a prestigious, fully funded master's scholarship program offered by the Swedish Institute (SI) for international students pursuing master's degrees in Sweden. Designed to attract future global leaders, it covers comprehensive expenses and targets individuals with demonstrated work and leadership experience from eligible countries, aiming to foster sustainable development and global cooperation. It replaces the former Swedish Institute Study Scholarships (SISS) and supports full-time, one- or two-year master's studies in a large number of eligible master's programs at various Swedish universities, commencing in the autumn semester.
Application_Documents:
*   Proof of work/leadership experience
*   Two different reference letters (at least one work-based)
*   Curriculum Vitae (CV) using the official SISGP form
*   Motivation letter using the official SISGP form
Timeline:
15 January 2025 : Master's Program Application Deadline (approximate)
10 February 2025 : Scholarship Application Opening Date
26 February 2025 : Scholarship Application Deadline
26 March 2026 : University Admissions Results announced

Funding_Level: Full scholarship, Tuition Waiver, Stipend, Other Costs
Funding_Details:
The scholarship is government-funded and covers full tuition fees. The duration of the scholarship is determined by the academic years required for program completion:
*   Doctoral programs: 4 years
*   Master's programs: 3 years
*   Research programs: 6 months to 1 year
*   Undergraduate studies: 4 years of academic study following a mandatory one-year Korean language training program.
Covered Expenses:
*   Tuition fees
*   Living costs
*   Monthly allowance
*   Health insurance
*   Airfare
Quantity:
Approximately 1,300 prospective undergraduate and graduate students are selected annually.
Undergraduate programs: 367 general awards, 150 for Bachelor's degrees via the Embassy Track, 130 via the University Track, and a total of 262 spots open worldwide for undergraduate and associate programs.
Specific allocations can vary by country; for example, 8 scholarships were allocated for Singaporean applicants in 2025.
Eligibility: Applicants must meet specific nationality, age, and health requirements.
Eligible_Applicants:
Nationality:
*   Applicants and their parents must not hold Korean citizenship.
*   Applicants must be citizens of NIIED-designated countries.
*   For the GKS-UIC (Industry-Academia Cooperation) program within the University Track, nationals of all countries (excluding Korea) are eligible.
Age Requirements:
*   General applicants: Must be under 40 years old (born after September 1, 1984).
*   Professors from ODA recipient countries: Must be under 45 years old.
*   Undergraduate applicants (e.g., Afghans): Must be under 25 years of age (born after March 1, 2001).
Health:
*   Applicants must be in good health, both mentally and physically, to study in Korea for the full duration of the program.
Eligible_Fields:
All available fields of study offered by designated universities are generally eligible.
Master's/PhD level: Korean studies, humanities, social sciences, natural sciences, engineering.
Required_Degree: Bachelor's degree, Bachelor's equivalent, Final Year Student, Relevant Master's degree
Age: Under 40 (General applicants), Under 45 (Professors from ODA recipient countries), Under 25 (Undergraduate applicants)
Career_Plan: Future plans and career goals are a mandatory component, typically articulated within the Personal Statement (Form 2) and Study Plan (Form 3).
Other_Requirements:
One letter of Recommendation (Form 5) is required. It must be signed and sealed by the recommender and can be written in English or Korean.
GKS recipients are generally required to complete a one-year Korean language program and attain TOPIK Level 3 or higher.
Scholarship_Info: The Global Korea Scholarship (GKS), also known as KGSP, is a prestigious, fully funded scholarship program offered by the Government of the Republic of Korea. Administered by the National Institute for International Education (NIIED) through its Global Korea Scholarship Center, the program aims to provide international students with opportunities to pursue higher education in South Korea, fostering global education exchange and strengthening ties. The scholarship covers a wide range of academic programs from undergraduate to doctoral levels, offering comprehensive financial support and a structured application process through both Embassy and University Tracks.
Application_Documents:
Application Guidelines
Application Form (Form 1, available in PDF/DOCS)
Personal Statement (Form 2)
Study Plan (Form 3)
Research Proposal (Form 4) (ONLY for Research Program applicants)
GKS Applicant Agreement
Applicant's Proof of Citizenship
One Letter of Recommendation (Form 5), signed and sealed by the recommender
Certificates of Employment or Working Experience (Optional)
Other optional documents
